text: Draft at Ginger Man. Clear copper pour with s small head and light lace. Caramel, toffee, and nuts on the style and flavor. Light sweet, malty, and a touch bitter. Very clean.

One Mile House, NYC tap: pours lighter than your average mild. Aroma is caramel, biscuits, sweet malts. Taste is malty with low but not invisible hoppiness. Very easy to drink whether you go fast or slow.
On tap at The Jeffery. Poured hazy brown orange with white head. Aroma super honey comb and malts. Light carb med bod. Taste super malt pretzel some honey sweetness light overall
Draft. Golden pour with tan head. Light sweet malts, biscuits, toast, caramel tones. Light malty, caramel, toast, biscuity Flavors.

Draught at the fermentorium, 6/11/16.Deep honey golden body is quite bright with good clarity and a small but well-retained white head atop.Fruity yeast notes mix with light white bread, honey and vanilla, showing good balance and overall soft, mild aromatics that tickle the nose. Some moderate minerality and light plaster add charm, as well, and theres a touch of herbal/peppery hop notes mixed in, for good measure. No alcohol or flaw.Soft, plush malts provide huge amounts of honey and vanilla. Some caramel malt graininess/toastiness is evident on the finish, but it works to balance the sweeter maris otter notes. Mineral water and light yellow and red fruit esters seem very appropriate as gentle, but pleasing hop bitterness adds crispness to the finish. Very drinkable and flavorful with charming yet clean yeast and water notes. Low but mostly tight carbonation.

On tap at fermentaria. Pours a clear golden yellow with a light fluffy white head. Aroma of bready yeast, hints of lemon, sweet fruit, and honey. Taste is grainy, notes of honey topped bread, and sweet fruit.

On draft at Tired Hands Fermentaria. The pour is a amber tinted good color with a thin film of white head that leaves a pretty good amount of lace as it falls. The aroma is strange. There is a strong strange maltiness. The raisins are present for sure, and the breadiness is something that does help deter from the strangely sweet malt. There is a little dirty earthiness on the way back. Im not a fan of this aroma at all. The flavor is really sweet and messy. Its bright and sweet. There is a strong breadiness that controls most of it. There is a bitterness that I believe is tied to the hop, but its like its a muddy hop. There is a strong dirt addition to it. The mouth feel is pretty good for a mild. Its a little heavy, but nicely carbonated. The aftertaste falls off quick, and its dirty hop and a hint of malt. This one is really strange, and this seems to be a theme here.

UPDATED: JUN 13, 2016 Flight at Tired Hands with koleminer20. Aroma is raisins, dry, sweet fruit, robust, strange for a mild. Appearance is dark golden, white head, somewhat hazy. Taste is robust malt, raisins, dry, bitter, some sweetness. Mouthfeel is light to medium body, light carbonation, dry, weird roasted aftertaste. Overall, this one is weird, a theme for this brewery. Still, good.
Draft - pours orange white head - nose/taste of honey, golden raison, caramel bread - medium body.
On cask at the brewery. Pours a hazy yellow gold with medium frothy white head. The aroma is strong spice, toasted malt, honey. Thin mouth, roast, cocoa, floral, light finish, really nice
On tap at TJs. Poured a golden to amber color with a smaller sized head. Caramel with some toastiness. A bit on the thin and softer side.
Draft at the cafe with Linh. Pours a deep murky, amber body with thin lacing. Notes of soft bread, kiwi, mango juice; low bitterness on the palate. Pretty sessionable.

On cask at Cafe, pours golden brown with creamy head and lacing. Notes of toast, Scottish biscuit, malt, caramel, and misc. grain. Medium to fuller body with light carbonation. Very crushable...would love to try the new version of this with Mosaic.

From tap. Pours hazy orange with a small off white head. Aroma is mild fruity, toasted malty. Light caramelish. Toasted and slight malty to caramelish. Mild bitter and light herbal. Dry and bitter finish.
Pours a light Amber with a thin white head. Aroma of bread, caramel and grain. Taste is malty, bready, slightly sweet but finishes slightly dry. Very nice.

Orange colored body, medium sized off-white head, and soapy lacing. Cracker, morning toast, marmalade, honey, toffee, and florals. Medium bodied, mild carbonation, a touch of bitterness, restrained sweetness, and a nice, robust finish.
